body_html:
Hi, sorry for the late respnose.

Thank you all so much for the replies, and yes, including the headers in the pip package would eventually save a lot of time, since the compilation takes a while. It would also probably make life a bit easier for everyone, as it would make sure that the same flags and configs are used in build builds.

@asimshankar
I mean something similar to
third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor
( https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/master/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor )

It does some minimal definitions and mostly just re-includes itself.

@vit-stepanovs was kind enough to reply to my email and shared the following link with me
https://gist.github.com/guschmue/2908e4411edc2faef6ddfe87a2ce4a1d
This seems to be exactly what I need (thanks @guschmue). Cmakes manages to create the VS project now and I'll compile either later on today or tomorrow at some point. I'll let you know how it went.
In case it's working though, it'd probably be a good idea to include this additional file into the main repo (assuming @guschmue won't mind)

body:
Hi, sorry for the late respnose.

Thank you all so much for the replies, and yes, including the headers in the pip package would eventually save a lot of time, since the compilation takes a while. It would also probably make life a bit easier for everyone, as it would make sure that the same flags and configs are used in build builds.

@asimshankar 
I mean something similar to 
third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor
( https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/master/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor )

It does some minimal definitions and mostly just re-includes itself.

@vit-stepanovs was kind enough to reply to my email and shared the following link with me
https://gist.github.com/guschmue/2908e4411edc2faef6ddfe87a2ce4a1d
This seems to be exactly what I need (thanks @guschmue). Cmakes manages to create the VS project now and I'll compile either later on today or tomorrow at some point. I'll let you know how it went.
In case it's working though, it'd probably be a good idea to include this additional file into the main repo (assuming @guschmue won't mind)
